metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12019 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The signature verification routine in Enigmail before 2.0.7 interprets user ids as status/control messages and does not correctly keep track of the status of multiple signatures, which allows remote attackers to spoof arbitrary email signatures via public keys containing crafted primary user ids.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:2.2.4-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.2.4-0.3').
